fields.summary: On IE6 the color picker of the global configuration does not pop up

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: This is what I thought you might be doing when you implemented capacity planning in 3.7.  Although I really like the new feature, the most common requested feature here is capacity in hours per person per version.  I would also like this compared to the total original estimate for all issues in a version for that assignee and highlight it red if it is larger.  We were thinking of a Resource Board where this data could be entered into a grid column.  One row for each resource.  Other columns could sum the original estimate and remaining on all their assigned tasks.
fields.summary: As a GH user, I would like to be able set a capacity in hours per assignee (developer role) per version (sprint).

fields.description:
It works fine with 12 subtasks or less.  After 12 subtasks the GH dialog tries to show pages of subtasks when dragging the story, but it fails to display any subtasks at all so the dialog just looks blank w/2 pages see http://skitch.com/cbrookins/bc3qr/planning-board

 This is a big bug for us and impeding our use of Greenhopper - there is no workaround that I see
fields.summary: When dragging a story to another version on planning boarrd, if there are > 12 subtasks Greenhopper doesn't move any subtasks

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hello,
On the cards the original estimate and remaining times are displayed in days and hours, e.g. 4 days, 3 hours. In our team we have different development capacities for team members. Therefore it is misleading to have a fix mapping between days and hours and we would prefer to always have all times displayed in hours only.
This setting should be done on a project level, because we do not want to impact other jira projects and users.
Is there a possibility to suppress this hours to days conversion?
Thanks, a lot for your support. Best regards, 
Jürgen
fields.summary: Hour to day conversion on issue cards obligatory?

fields.description: As a manager, I like to know what the people in my team are working on for a given iteration. If I can go to the taskboard and have a context with a filter that grabs issues assigned only to people I manage, the taskboard becomes usable to quickly getting an overall status of the progress for my team, like a real agile wall. (this is needed because some other people part of the team are not directly under me).
fields.summary: Allow multiple Assignee to be choosen in a context filter.

See the rationale in practice here: http://www.joelonsoftware.com/items/2007/10/26.html
FogBugz has this feature, which is really neat: http://www.fogcreek.com/FogBugz/learnmore.html#hist_PredictShipDates

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We are using JIRA 3.13.2 and GH 3.5.
After restarting JIRA instance GreenHopper forgets the ranking field, and we have to reconfigure project.
When I look into database I see the following configuration piece
   <string>RANNKING_FIELDS</string>
   <set>
     <string>customfield_10060</string>
   </set>
I notice that 'ranking' has to letters N, possibly a typo. I see that previous versions of GH did not use the RANNKING_FIELDS string in configuration.
Any advice on how to cope the problem?
fields.summary: Restarting JIRA make GH forget the 'ranking field' configuration

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Recipe:

* GREENHOPPER -> RELEASED
* GH shows: New card | RELEASE CHARTS | View | PROJECT OVERVIEW | BURNDOWN CHART | For Story Points | Recompute
* Change RELEASE CHARTS to RELEASE NOTES
* Change RELEASE NOTES to RELEASE CHARTS
* GH shows: New card | RELEASE CHARTS | View | PROJECT OVERVIEW | NO SNAPSHOTS FOUND
* Click CHART BOARD
* Click RELEASED
* GH shows: New card | RELEASE CHARTS | View | PROJECT OVERVIEW | BURNDOWN CHART | For Story Points | Recompute
fields.summary: Released charts says "No snapshots found" when there are snapshots

fields.description: I have a time edit field (original estimate) and a number edit field (for 90/10 estimate) next to each other.  The edit (pencil) icon next to the Original Estimate field is aligned to the right of the text but the edit icon for the numeric field is aligned to the right of the card.
fields.summary: The edit icons should line up for various field types

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The Assignee Board was added in 3.6 which would be a very useful feature.  I understand from the release notes that there is a limitation that this feature is not available if there are more than 75 users due to performance.

This request is to improve the performance such that this feature can be used for large projects.
fields.summary: As a scrum master I would like to have the Assignee Board work for my project which has more than 75 potential assignees

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Assignee board is limited to 75 assignable users - It would be nice if I could enable the assignee board for users in project roles, rather than all users.

This would allow me to use it.
fields.summary: Enable toggle of Assignee Board assignable users list between "All Users" and "Users in Project Roles"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: As a user (in Sprint or in Sprint planning) I would like to be able to drag a subtask from one task to another in the planning board and in the task board.
fields.summary: Allow dragging subtasks from one task to another

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have been investigating a difference in the remaining estimates shown by the Greenhopper task board and chart board, and it looks like the interpretation of a cleared remaining estimate field isn't handled proberly in the chart board view. 

I have attached a dump of the change view for a corrupt issue together with the chart board data export for the issue.

It appears that a clearing af a remaining estimate field freezes the remaining estimate before the clearing in the Chart board models, and isn't updated after this, even if the remaining estimate value is set again.
fields.summary: Chart board unable to handle clearing of remaining estimate

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I use a custom field of type SelectList for Story Points. The select list would contain numeric values for the story points we can choose. 

I would like to use this custom field (the selected value) in the burndown charts and statistics on the planning board. 

Is this possible? Will it be possible? Everything I've read states the custom field needs to be a numeric type in order for it to work. Since we've already started with the select list, this causes an issue to change field types.
fields.summary: Support for SelectList field types in statistics

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I added a new issue type to an existing JIRA project.  I am able to create a new issue of this issue type via JIRA.  But if I try to create it through GreenHopper's quick card creation, I get a system error and the issue does not get created.  The existing issue types work fine, I just get an error with the new issue type.  Please help!  

See attached files for more details.

Thanks!
fields.summary: error creating an issue  using quick card creation

fields.description: If i delete an issue that i'm viewing through the popup view in a planning board, when i close the popup, the planning board sits and loads forever. If i hit refresh on my browser and resend the transaction, everything loads ok.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Is there a way we can get the formulas that you are using for the chart boards?    We have created different statuses than just to do --in progress and --- done.   We move from to-do ---to--- in development -- to in QA -- to done. our task board mappings are

To do =  open, and custom status "in product management"  
In Progress  = in Progress, and custom status "in Development"
custom task board of "in QA"= custom status of "in QA"
Done =  verified or closed

We are trying to understand the numbers that are being used to draw the charts
fields.summary: Formulas for chart boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We would like to automate our release procedures as much as possible, including the release procedure in Jira + GreenHopper. Similar to the releaseVersion     method in the Jira SOAP API, we would like to see an interface for GreenHopper. This of course should result in all actions that happen in the manual release procedure through GreenHopper including the saving of charts, etc.
fields.summary: Provide a SOAP API to release a version through GreenHopper

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: I would like to be able to drill into the numbers and view the actual defects the comprise the chart
fields.summary: As a project manager I would like to drill into the issue data from the chart board.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have a need to measure the progress of issues moving from open or "in development" status  to going into "in QA" status  and then measure going from "in QA" status to Verified or closed status.

This would allow us to know where we are in the development / qa cycle. Do we need to move more people to test or is all of the work queued up in development.
fields.summary: As a project manager I would like to be alble to set the start and finish dates for the chart board with in the context filter.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Generation of charts with greater than a couple hundred issues is slow

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: when on the task board if I edit contexts greenhopper generates the charts autmatically.   I would like a button for "generate chart"
fields.summary: As a project manager I would like the ability to edit contexts without having the charts generated each time in order to save time when crating and managing contexts.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Once a month, at the beginning of a Sprint, we take a look at the Planning Board in order to check and reorder priorities. We think that the best view for us would be the one which orders by Sprint (first criteria) and by Rank (second criteria).

The problem is that the drag and drop functionality only works when the next conditions are met.

Reordering issues by drag and drop:
1) Make sure you have added your Ranking field in you JIRA custom fields and associated it to your project and all issue types 
2) Make sure you have added the Ranking field in your Project > PlanningBoard > Configuration > General > Ranking field 
3) Make sure the context is "Sorted by" your ranking field. 
4) Make sure you have the permission to Resolve issues.

It would be very useful if the drag and drop functionality worked under other scenarios as well.
fields.summary: Drap and drop when ordering by Sprint and Rank (two criteria)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: I am trying to configure the "default dashboard" so that it can be understood by other departments of my company. The profile of that users will be one with very little (or null) knowledge of Jira and Greenhopper. I am trying to make it easy so that they can browse the exact information which they need. I would need two links from the "default dashboard" to the Planning Board of two different projects. Furthermore, when the link is clicked, I would need that the Planning Board is displayed using an specified filter which I will have properly configured for them. I found out that I can configure the "Introduction Portlet" with the following content: ********* Please choose a report: Project Board Version Board ********* It is perfect!! The problem is that I do not know how to select the initial filter. I do not want to force the user to choose the filter (probably he or she will not have any idea of which to choose), but I would rather select one for him/her. Could you please provide a way to choose the filter in a variable of the URL? Regards.
fields.summary: Direct link from "Introduction Portlet" to "Planning Board" and "Task Board"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have a number of required field in jira that are not triggered as mandantory fields when moving across the task board.   This prevents us from filling in things such as comments, code reviewed by and other mandantory fields.
fields.summary: As a Scrum team member I would like to be able to fill in required fields when moving across the task board in order to report mandantory Jira fields

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: In our second instance in GlobalLogic we are using JIRA 3.13.2 with greenhopper plugin 3.5. One of our project/version (possibly more) is released, but does not appear in RELEASED tab among other released projects, and we therefore can not see its charts. Also when I check the Charts folder I see that images are created, in the projectID/versionID subfolder, with proper file time change attributes. I think it might be some misconfiguration in GH, but no idea where to look. We do release the version via version box release link in planning board. Please advise.
fields.summary: Released version does not appear in RELEASED tab

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
So far this has only been seen in (1) of our multiple projects in JIRA. See screen shots attached for more information. Note issues do not have a strike through the issue key even though they are marked resolved/closed by JIRA.

We are running the most recent version (3.6) of GreenHopper with JIRA 3.13. Re-indexing seems to have no impact on the problem.
fields.summary: Issues that have been marked as resolved/closed do not have strike through the issue key in GreenHopper.

The contexts are per boards.
The issue view should also be.
fields.summary: Persist the Issue type view per board

fields.summary: the summary field of cards has a length limit, but I don't know what it is when I'm typing the summary.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: in the user preference of the planning board, when I enter a number of cards to display "/row", the value I enter is not taken correctly.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: As a GH user, I would like to see my projected value (velocity) demarcated on my Unscheduled backlog of my Planning Board.  Using the previous sprints value as a default, I would like the expected sprints to be graphically represented in the List view of the Planning Board.  One idea is to draw a line above the story that would exceed the expected value.  I should be able to change the value to see how it affects my roadmap.  This is somewhat related to the capacity planning stories in 3.7 but since I haven't seen how your implementing it, I'm not sure if this fits within that feature.
fields.summary: As a GH user, I would like to see my projected value (velocity) demarcated on my Unscheduled backlog of my Planning Board.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, when rendering the greenhopper portlet from confluence using the jiraportlet macro and using the staticView parameter, one cannot specify the context to use. As a result, if my chart only shows meaningful data in a particular context, I am at the mercy of the last person who modified the context on that particular project to select the right one.
It will be very useful to allow users to specify the context by name in the jiraportlet macro.
fields.summary: Allow the context to be specified on the greenhopper portlet when used from confluence.

fields.description: As odd as it sounds, there is a problem in List mode vs. Card mode.  In this one example the correct values are 4 Subs and 17h remaining.  In List view, it shows as 5 Subs and 29h remaining.  If you double-click the item to open the full Card view, the Card is correct.  Only the List Item displays it wrong.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently, you can use the "Value" chart (by children) to see the story point velocity across sprint releases if they are rolled up under another release.  However, what if sprints don't have a parent or if you want to see the velocity across releases.  A suggested implementation would to have an "ALL" option in the GH portlet that would allow you to create a value chart across all sprint releases.  Further, it would be beneficial to have this option on the chart board as well.
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like to view story points velocity across all releases of a project.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Please add a "Characters Remaining" field to the Cards so that you do not get held up by an error message about "* Summary: String too long!" -- it would be nice to know how many characters are left while you are typing the summary up.
fields.summary: Summary String Length Counter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: The redirect of the projects that have more then 75 assignees ends up in a 404

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently, when you are editing work log values on a card in the Task Board, the current values are not displayed. It would be really useful to see what the current values are while you are editing so you don't have to flip back and forth to figure out if you need to reestimate something. Also, some of our users like to tell us how many hours they have left instead of how many hours they have worked so we have to remember the number of hours and do math in our heads at the same time.
fields.summary: Show the current work log field values when editing hours in the Task Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: In JIRA, you can add java script to a field description to automatically populate text into a field when a new issue is created. It would be great if this text also showed up when you create new issues through GreenHopper.
fields.summary: Populate fields in new cards/tasks with text from java script in field descriptions

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Every Jira project has a list of project members, I want my assignee board to be able to be configured to just show those assignees or else there is just too many assignees diplayed on the board to be useful.

Even better, I'd like to be able to filter the assignee board by roles, so I can create various roles within assignees for "Designers", "QA", etc. and get an idea how those sub teams are allocated (not as important a request as the 1st one)
fields.summary: As a scrum master, I need a way to limit the assignees in the assignee board to just the project's team members, so that I am not overwhlemed with a huge list of users

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In JIRA the PRIORITY field is not mandatory by default. It should inherit the settings from JIRA.
In some of our projects, either we do not use PRIORITY field or use a different custom field. In those projects, when we create an issue through GH, it displays the PRIORITY field by default, which is confusing among users.
fields.summary: Field configuration not inherited from JIRA screen schemes & field configuration

fields.summary: NullPointerException emitted from velocity on Admin > Global Settings > Greenhopper page

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I followed the instructions to install the Greenhopper extension in Jira as documented on this link:
http://www.greenpeppersoftware.com/confluence/display/GH/FAQ+AND+SUPPORT#FAQANDSUPPORT-faq

The last step says "To enter your licence go to JIRA --> ADMINISTRATION --> System --> GreenHopper Licence
right under JIRA licence details link "

Problem is, there is no "GreenHopper Licence" under System.  Please help
fields.summary: No "Greenhopper Licence" link under System area in Jira

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We are noticing some poor performance when using the planning board.  This seems to get worse the more issues in a version, which is especially noticeable in adding items to the  "Unscheduled" version (which can typically be large).  We did some initial analysis and at first glance it appears that a lot of individual queries are being run for issues that are not actually being displayed on the page.  Can some optimization be done in this area?  On some projects it is making the application difficult to use, as we typically would add new items from this view.
fields.summary: Planning Board Performance

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Right now you can check "My issues" on the greenhopper screen and then go back to the "home" section and see the GreenHopper portlet saying it is displaying a milestone and a context.  But it is in fact displaying "my issues" for that milestone and context.

This is really confusing to new users who accidentally click "my issues" and then see the portlet's chart which doesn't say anything about showing only their issues.   Often resulting in them emailing the team saying:  "OMG! guys we are soo far ahead of schedule"  heheh  :-)
fields.summary: Jira Greenhopper Portlet needs to have a "my issues" check box on it

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
So right now we have:

# Team effort
Curve of the total time worked by the team

# Required Daily Burndown Rate Curve
Curve giving the daily rate to achieve to attain your goal.


It would be nice to also show the total hours worked each day.  So you can see if you are over / under the "Required Daily Burndown Rate Curve" that is at the bottom of the chart.  (e.g. it would be nice to see that you had t to have a team effort of 100 hours and you got 150!!! hours! that day!)

You can do this now with some math, but it would be nicer to have another graph.
fields.summary: Show the amount of hours worked each day on the chart

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Security scheme of subtasks are not inherited from the parent

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: See attached files.
fields.summary: Clicking at the bottom of the list selects all text in planning board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When you create a new issue, it can be cumbersome to locate the card on the board and then open it up to make sure you have entered all the details correctly. It would be great if GreenHopper could open the JIRA IFrame window for the newly created issue so you could review the issue details immediately. It would also be useful if this were a user configurable setting so you when you are entering a lot of issues, you don't have to click through that window every time.
fields.summary: Open a JIRA IFrame window when a new issue is created

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: The patch should clean the GH private filters and make sure none are duplicated.
fields.summary: In JIRA 3.13 series every search creates a new private filter.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When I edit a single field by clicking the edit icon, enter (or alternative shortcut key) should submit the field.
fields.summary: Enter (or an alternative shortcut key) should save a field which is in edit mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When I click edit on a card which has a custom numeric field the text will contain "N/A" which is not a valid value.  In order to enter a value I have to delete the text before I can enter a value.  The Original Estimate field works as I would expect a custom numeric field, it shows N/A until you click edit.  When you click Edit the field switches to an empty text box.
fields.summary: When I edit a Numeric typed custom user field which has no value the default value should be empty

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
On the task board, when viewing summaries, there is the option to assign items.  The list of assignees is not listed in alphabetical order - but it is close.  This is confusing and hard to locate the correct assignee.

Example:
Alex Ad
Andrew Boy
Aus Gill
Alex Howe
Adam Rob


The names do list correctly in JIRA, so it appears to be specific to the Greenhopper plug-in.

Observed in Greenhopper v3.5.
fields.summary: Task Board: Assignees not listed alphabetically

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: On http://www.greenpeppersoftware.com/confluence/display/GH/CHART+BOARD, section II lists the burndown in blue and the team effort in green.  These should be reversed.
fields.summary: Chartboard Documentation Describes burndown chart incorrectly

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We are using latest GH plugin (3.5-jira313).We are facing an issue where on entering into GreenHopper tab, the Issue cards are not showing up in the planning board though issues are present (default List view is selected).

When we selected Summaries view then we can see issue cards are displayed and now when we select list view now issues are displayed correctly.

Also in List view last records are not displayed correctly
fields.summary: Issues are not showing up in the board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have renamed a lot of the default field names to support our process. The rest of Jira respects the strings specified in:

atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport.properties

however GH seems to ignore them
fields.summary: Greenhopper should respect strings in JiraWebActionSupport.properties

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Whenever I close an issue in the planning board while showing a context w/a saved filter (and maybe this happens in lots of other conditions too) I get a message box saying Greenhopper can't display the issue based on the current criteria.  This is really annoying and disruptive to the UX to constantly have to dismiss these trivial error messages in the greenhopper UI.  Please at a minimum display these messages w/o a pop up dialog somewhere at the bottom of the UI in a dismissible or optional status line
fields.summary: Eliminate as many error message boxes as possible from Greenhopper UI

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: At the moment, the print chart window only displays the chart and the legend. It should also show the chart context, start date, end date, etc.. so that we know what the printed chart is for.
fields.summary: Remove: 'Print Chart' option from chart board and released board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: I would like the ability to enter log work when transitioning an issue in the task board.  This way we dont have to go back to JIRA seperately and use the Log work screen.
fields.summary: Greenhopper should allow you to log work when transitioning.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently it is simply ??? until you explicitly set it which makes the charts useless until you do. Can there be an option to enable this functionality?
fields.summary: New version should have default "start date" as the previous version's "end date" + 1

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We are using greenhopper across 4 development teams each with their own jira project. We manage all "projects" within a separate bucket and epics/stories are created in the related teams backlogs. There is no way to easily see "what" the total estimated work is for a project without manually calculating as some projects have cross team dependencies etc.

From a project management perspective it would be great if you could roll up watched fields along a dependency chain. Meaning at the project level you could easily see how much work has been estimated.
fields.summary: Sum "watched" fields of all issues with a dependency chain

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When accessing GreenHopper 3.5 on either Safari or Chrome browsers there is whitespace at the top of the page.  See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Whitespace in header using GreenHopper on Chrome & Safari

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently it's shown with a silly amount of decimals
fields.summary: Custom number fields in the portlet & planning board should be displayed with rounding off

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: As a project manager, I would like to be able to very distinctly tell when I am in the "default" context so as to not modify it accidentally

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When creating sub-tasks from the Task Board, it would be nice to have a keyboard shortcut to save and save and close the window to eliminate the need to switch between the keyboard and mouse.
fields.summary: Add a keyboard shortcut to the Adding Sub-task window from the Task Board for Create and Create and Close

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps:
1. open the Task Board
2. click the edit button to update work log hours
3. enter a reestimate but do not enter time spent
4. click Add
5. when the error window opens, click OK to close the window

Observed:
Clicking OK does not close the error window. You have to refresh the screen to close the window and whatever you entered is lost.

Expected:
Clicking OK should close the error window.

NOTE: This problem exists in both Firefox and IE7.
fields.summary: Clicking OK on "Time Spent can not be zero" error window does not close window

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: In IE 6 and 7 the Filter and Highlight frame are way to wide!

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Greenhopper configurations need to be better protected against unintended changes. We are using several custom issue types and have task board mappings and card configurations specific to the issue types. It is too easy for a project admin to completely wipe out these mappings and configurations (reset back to the default), or to accidentally apply one cards viewpoint to all the others. When this happens there is no quick way to recover them. It is necessary to reapply each configuration manually, assuming the admin can remember what they all were.

These configurations are becoming encoded in our business processes - users expect to see certain data on the cards and the cards in certain columns based upon mappings. Unintended sudden changes are not good.

Please provide some way of protecting these configurations by allowing the admin to export/import configurations (perhaps as XML), or by allowing configurations to be versioned and revertable. 

It would also be useful to decouple the greenhopper administration tasks from the project administraton role if possible. We have several lead developers who have project administration rights (in order to add versions, components, set dates etc) but who shouldn't be able to change greenhopper configurations.
fields.summary: Protect greenhopper configurations!

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: As a product manager using greenhopper I would like to have components available on the context filter screen in order to narrow my contexts without using a saved filter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: As a general user, I would mostly use the task board and not the planning board. As it currently stands, I cannot switch to the Taskboard directly, I have to go to GH -> task board since GH always opens the planning board first.
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like GH to remember the last visited tab.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: In IE7 the cursor is being reloaded on every issue hover

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
So on the burn down chart "Estimation accuracy" is yellow which makes it basically impossible to see on a white background.

Being able to change the colors would be really nice.  Both the colors of the actual graphs and the background of the graph.
fields.summary: Changing the burndown chart colors

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
# Static portlets
# Permlinks
fields.summary: Support the context as a parameter in the url

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We would like the ability to share contexts with certain groups or project roles, similar to how JIRA shares dashboards and filters.
fields.summary: Would like the ability to share contexts with certain groups or project roles.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: in our jira we including jQuery on every page and i think (cannot excatly determine, because havn't GH unpacked js) it causes error on iFrame opening (all browsers), and sends you to Issue Page
fields.summary: Greenhopper puts own javascript in global namespace

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: If your look in source of jira webpage you can find, what Jira links is not capitalized. They uses CSS.
fields.summary: Greenhopper Link in top nvagation shouldn't be capitalized.
